value.title: Secure your cloud data in Azure learning path
value.excerpt: This learning path helps you leverage the built-in Azure services for securing app data, ensuring that only authorized services and clients have access.

topItems.title: Security, responsibility, and trust in Azure
topItems.excerpt: Discuss the basic concepts for protecting your infrastructure and data when you work in the cloud. Understand what responsibilities are yours and what Azure takes care of for you.

images.title: Security, responsibility, and trust in Azure

topItems.title: Top 5 security items to consider before pushing to production
topItems.excerpt: Secure your web applications on Azure and protect your apps against the most common and dangerous web application attacks.

images.title: Top 5 security items to consider before pushing to production

topItems.title: Configure security policies to manage data
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to set up policies to classify, retain, and protect your cloud-based data.

images.title: Configure security policies to manage data

topItems.title: Secure your Azure Storage account
topItems.excerpt: Learn how Azure Storage provides multilayered security to protect your data. Find out how to use access keys, to secure networks, and to use Advanced Threat Protection to proactively monitor your system.

images.title: Secure your Azure Storage account
Security, responsibility, and trust in Azure

value.title: Secure your cloud data
value.excerpt: Azure was designed for security and compliance. Learn how to leverage the built-in services to store your app data securely to ensure that only authorized services and clients have access to it.

topItems.title: Security, responsibility, and trust in Azure
topItems.excerpt: Discuss the basic concepts for protecting your infrastructure and data when you work in the cloud. Understand what responsibilities are yours and what Azure takes care of for you.

topItems.title: Secure your Azure Storage account
topItems.excerpt: Learn how Azure Storage provides multilayered security to protect your data. Find out how to use access keys, to secure networks, and to use Advanced Threat Protection to proactively monitor your system.

images.title: Secure your Azure Storage account
Security, responsibility, and trust in Azure

value.title: Secure your cloud applications in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to secure your Azure apps and associated data with encryption, certificates, and policy.

topItems.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Security
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to incorporate security into your architecture design, and discover the tools that Azure provides to help you create a secure environment through all the layers of your architecture.

images.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Security

topItems.title: Top 5 security items to consider before pushing to production
topItems.excerpt: Secure your web applications on Azure and protect your apps against the most common and dangerous web application attacks.

images.title: Top 5 security items to consider before pushing to production

topItems.title: Create security baselines
topItems.excerpt: Create security baselines

images.title: Create security baselines

topItems.title: Manage secrets in your server apps with Azure Key Vault
topItems.excerpt: Your application requires service passwords, connection strings, and other secret configuration values to do its job. Storing and handling secret values is risky, and every usage introduces the possibility of leakage. Azure Key Vault, in combination with managed identities for Azure resources, enables your Azure web app to access secret configuration values easily and securely without needing to store any secrets in your source control or configuration.

images.title: Manage secrets in your server apps with Azure Key Vault
Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Security

value.title: AZ-400: Develop a security and compliance plan
value.excerpt:
Build strategies around security and compliance that enable you to authenticate and authorize your users, handle sensitive information, and enforce proper governance.
Take this learning path to help prepare for Exam AZ-400: Designing and Implementing Microsoft DevOps Solutions.

topItems.title: Secure your identities by using Azure Active Directory
topItems.excerpt: Secure internal resources, external resources, SaaS applications, and more by using Azure Active Directory. Learn about the features and capabilities of Azure AD.

images.title: Secure your identities by using Azure Active Directory

topItems.title: Create Azure users and groups in Azure Active Directory
topItems.excerpt: Create users in Azure Active Directory. Understand different types of groups. Create a group and add members. Manage business-to-business guest accounts.

images.title: Create Azure users and groups in Azure Active Directory

topItems.title: Authenticate apps to Azure services by using service principals and managed identities for Azure resources
topItems.excerpt: Securely authenticate applications to Azure to manage and access Azure services. Service principals and managed identities for Azure resources give your app an Azure Active Directory identity.

images.title: Authenticate apps to Azure services by using service principals and managed identities for Azure resources

topItems.title: Configure and manage secrets in Azure Key Vault
topItems.excerpt: Storing and handling secrets, encryption keys, and certificates directly is risky, and every usage introduces the possibility of unintentional data exposure. Azure Key Vault provides a secure storage area for managing all your app secrets so you can properly encrypt your data in transit or while it's being stored.

images.title: Configure and manage secrets in Azure Key Vault
Secure your identities by using Azure Active Directory

value.title: AZ-400: Develop an instrumentation strategy
value.excerpt:
Learn how logging, telemetry, and monitoring give you full visibility into what's happening in your environment.
Take this learning path to help prepare for Exam AZ-400: Designing and Implementing Microsoft DevOps Solutions.

topItems.title: Capture Web Application Logs with App Service Diagnostics Logging
topItems.excerpt: Use application logs in Azure Web Apps to help debug web app code.

images.title: Capture Web Application Logs with App Service Diagnostics Logging

topItems.title: Control and organize Azure resources with Azure Resource Manager
topItems.excerpt: Use Azure Resource Manager to organize resources, enforce standards, and protect critical assets from deletion.

images.title: Control and organize Azure resources with Azure Resource Manager

topItems.title: Introduction to App Center
topItems.excerpt: Characterize the types of services offered by App Center. Describe the use of App Center to build, distribute, test, and analyze usage of apps.

images.title: Introduction to App Center

topItems.title: Azure Spring Cloud workshop
topItems.excerpt: In this workshop, you'll go through tasks to deploy Spring Boot microservices to Azure Spring Cloud (ASC).

images.title: Azure Spring Cloud workshop

value.title: Threat Modeling Security Fundamentals
value.excerpt: This learning path takes you through the four main phases of threat modeling, explains the differences between each data-flow diagram element, walks you through the threat modeling framework, recommends different tools and gives you a step-by-step guide on creating proper data-flow diagrams.

topItems.title: Introduction to threat modeling
topItems.excerpt: Threat modeling is an effective way to help secure your systems, applications, networks, and services. It's an engineering technique that identifies potential threats and recommendations to help reduce risk and meet security objectives earlier in the development lifecycle.

images.title: Introduction to threat modeling
Introduction to threat modeling

topItems.title: Create a threat model using data-flow diagram elements
topItems.excerpt: Data-flow diagrams are graphical representations of your system and should specify each element, their interactions and helpful context.

images.title: Create a threat model using data-flow diagram elements
Create a threat model using data-flow diagram elements

topItems.title: Provide Context with the Right Depth Layer
topItems.excerpt: Threat models can get complex if all parties involved cannot agree on a data-flow diagram depth layer that provides enough context to satisfy requirements

images.title: Provide Context with the Right Depth Layer

topItems.title: Approach your data-flow diagram with the right threat model focus
topItems.excerpt: Threat modeling is an effective technique to help you identify threats and ways to reduce or eliminate risk. We start by deciding to focus on either what needs to be protected or who it needs protection from.

images.title: Approach your data-flow diagram with the right threat model focus
Approach your data-flow diagram with the right threat model focus

value.excerpt: Identify the data in your organization and store it on Azure. Store secrets securely, and use client-side encryption and Storage Service Encryption to help protect your data.

images.title: Introduction to securing data at rest on Azure

value.title: Approach your data-flow diagram with the right threat model focus
value.excerpt: Threat modeling is an effective technique to help you identify threats and ways to reduce or eliminate risk. We start by deciding to focus on either what needs to be protected or who it needs protection from.

value.title: Introduction to threat modeling
value.excerpt: Threat modeling is an effective way to help secure your systems, applications, networks, and services. It's an engineering technique that identifies potential threats and recommendations to help reduce risk and meet security objectives earlier in the development lifecycle.

images.title: Introduction to threat modeling
Introduction to threat modeling

value.title: Prioritize your issues and apply security controls
value.excerpt: Threat modeling provides you with a list of threats and ways to reduce or eliminate risk, but it doesn't prioritize them for you. Also, there are no layered security control recommendations based on their type and function.

images.title: Prioritize your issues and apply security controls
Prioritize your issues and apply security controls

value.excerpt: Threat models can get complex if all parties involved cannot agree on a data-flow diagram depth layer that provides enough context to satisfy requirements

value.title: Use a Framework to Identify Threats and Find Ways to Reduce or Eliminate Risk
value.excerpt: Threat modeling helps you generate a list of potential threats using the threat modeling framework and find ways to reduce or eliminate risk with corresponding security controls.

images.title: Use a Framework to Identify Threats and Find Ways to Reduce or Eliminate Risk
Use a Framework to Identify Threats and Find Ways to Reduce or Eliminate Risk

value.title: Use Recommended Tools to Create a Data-Flow Diagram
value.excerpt: You can use any canvas, physical or virtual, to create a data-flow diagram. Engineers at Microsoft recommend a few tools to help you in your threat modeling journey.

images.title: Use Recommended Tools to Create a Data-Flow Diagram
Use Recommended Tools to Create a Data-Flow Diagram
